alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Yuma County through 600 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Yuma, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 5:25 PM MDT a trained spotter reported dime sized hail in Yuma, Colorado. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Yuma County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
